Query: Calculate y = sin(pi/5 * x) at x = 0 to 12 step by 1. In a 2x2 grid, make 4 plots with points, lines, both points and lines, and histogram-like vertical lines
Ref_Code:
## Show the different plot types
x <- 0:12
y <- sin(pi/5 * x)
op <- par(mfrow = c(2,2), mar = .1+ c(2,2,3,1))
for (tp in c("p","l","b","h")) {
    plot(y ~ x, type = tp, main = paste0("plot(*, type = "", tp, "")"))
}
par(op)
Gen_Code:
# make_plot
png(filename)
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))
x <- 0:12
y <- sin(pi/5 * x)

# Plot 1: Points
grid.plot(x, y, type = "p", main = "Points")

# Plot 2: Lines
grid.plot(x, y, type = "l", main = "Lines")

# Plot 3: Points and Lines
grid.plot(x, y, type = "b", main = "Points and Lines")

# Plot 4: Histogram-like vertical lines
plot(x, y, type = 'h', main = 'Histogram-like Lines')
dev.off()

# make_plot
png(filename)
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))
x <- 0:12
y <- sin(pi/5 * x)

# Plot 1: Points
plot(x, y, type = "p", main = "Points")

# Plot 2: Lines
plot(x, y, type = "l", main = "Lines")

# Plot 3: Points and Lines
plot(x, y, type = "b", main = "Points and Lines")

# Plot 4: Histogram-like vertical lines
plot(x, y, type = 'h', main = 'Histogram-like Lines')
dev.off()

Query: For the adult male passengers on the Titanic, make barplots of survivors and non-survivors subdivided by class
Ref_Code:
d.Titanic <- as.data.frame(Titanic)
barplot(Freq ~ Class + Survived, data = d.Titanic,
        subset = Age == "Adult" & Sex == "Male",
        main = "barplot(Freq ~ Class + Survived, *)", ylab = "# {passengers}", legend.text = TRUE)
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# help_topic
# 'topic': 'Titanic'

# make_plot
png(filename)
data(Titanic)
titanic_males <- as.data.frame(Titanic)[as.data.frame(Titanic)$Sex == "Male" & as.data.frame(Titanic)$Age == "Adult", ]
titanic_males_agg <- aggregate(Freq ~ Class + Survived, data = titanic_males, sum)
barplot(heights = titanic_males_agg$Freq,
        names.arg=paste(titanic_males_agg$Class, titanic_males_agg$Survived, sep="
"),
        col=c("red", "green"),
        las=2,
        main="Survival of Adult Male Passengers by Class",
        xlab="Class and Survival",
        ylab="Frequency",
        legend.text=c("Non-survived", "Survived"),
        args.legend=list(x="topright"))
dev.off()

# make_plot
png(filename)
data(Titanic)
titanic_males <- as.data.frame(Titanic)[as.data.frame(Titanic)$Sex == "Male" & as.data.frame(Titanic)$Age == "Adult", ]
titanic_males_agg <- aggregate(Freq ~ Class + Survived, data = titanic_males, sum)
bar_matrix <- matrix(titanic_males_agg$Freq, nrow=2, byrow=TRUE,
                     dimnames=list(c("Non-survived", "Survived"),
                                   unique(titanic_males_agg$Class)))
barplot(bar_matrix,
        beside=TRUE,
        col=c("red", "green"),
        main="Survival of Adult Male Passengers by Class",
        xlab="Class",
        ylab="Frequency",
        legend.text=c("Non-survived", "Survived"),
        args.legend=list(x="topright"))
dev.off()
Note: Use adult males from Titanic dataset. Use barplot to show numbers of passenger in terms of survival (x axis) and class (stacking in bars - 1,2,3,Crew).

Query: Stacked barplot of death rates in Virginia with ages indicated by shading lines, steeper for higher age
Ref_Code: barplot(VADeaths, angle = 15+10*1:5, density = 20, col = "black",\n        legend.text = rownames(VADeaths))\ntitle(main = list("Death Rates in Virginia", font = 4))
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# help_topic
# 'topic': 'VADeaths'

# make_ggplot
library(ggplot2)
VADeaths_df <- as.data.frame(as.table(VADeaths))
colnames(VADeaths_df) <- c("Age", "Group", "Rate")
VADeaths_df$Age <- as.ordered(VADeaths_df$Age)
VADeaths_df$linetype <- as.numeric(VADeaths_df$Age)

# Plot
p <- ggplot(VADeaths_df, aes(x = Group, y = Rate, fill = Group, linetype = Age)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "stack", colour = "black") +
  scale_linetype_manual(values = seq(1, 5)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  ggtitle("Stacked Barplot of Death Rates in Virginia (1940)") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

ggsave(filename, device = "png")
Note: Use shading lines instead of border line styles

Query: For tooth growth of guinea pigs, make side-by-side box plots of tooth length for ascorbic acid and orange juice at different vitamin C doses. Color the bars ascorbic acid - yellow and orange juice - orange
Ref_Code:
boxplot(len ~ dose, data = ToothGrowth,
        boxwex = 0.25, at = 1:3 - 0.2,
        subset = supp == "VC", col = "yellow",
        main = "Guinea Pigs' Tooth Growth",
        xlab = "Vitamin C dose mg",
        ylab = "tooth length",
        xlim = c(0.5, 3.5), ylim = c(0, 35), yaxs = "i")
boxplot(len ~ dose, data = ToothGrowth, add = TRUE,
        boxwex = 0.25, at = 1:3 + 0.2,
        subset = supp == "OJ", col = "orange")
legend(2, 9, c("Ascorbic acid", "Orange juice"),
       fill = c("yellow", "orange"))
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# make_ggplot
library(ggplot2)
data("ToothGrowth")
ggplot(ToothGrowth, aes(x = factor(dose), y = len, fill = supp)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("VC" = "yellow", "OJ" = "orange")) +
  labs(x = "Vitamin C Dose", y = "Tooth Length", fill = "Supplement") +
  theme_minimal()
ggsave(filename, device = "png")
Note: The plot is correct but the user didn't ask for ggplot

Query: You have the following data for NASA space shuttle o-ring failures where 1 means 'no' and 2 means 'yes': fail <- c(2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1) temperature <- c(53, 57, 58, 63, 66, 67, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70, 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81) Make a conditional density plot of o-ring failures given temperature
Ref_Code:
## NASA space shuttle o-ring failures
fail <- factor(c(2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1,
                 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1),
               levels = 1:2, labels = c("no", "yes"))
temperature <- c(53, 57, 58, 63, 66, 67, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70,
                 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81)

## CD plot
cdplot(fail ~ temperature)
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# help_topic
# 'topic': 'density'

# make_ggplot
library(ggplot2)
fail <- c(2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1)
temperature <- c(53, 57, 58, 63, 66, 67, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70, 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81)
df <- data.frame(fail = factor(fail, levels = 1:2, labels = c("No", "Yes")), temperature = temperature)
ggplot(df, aes(x = temperature, fill = fail)) +
  geom_density(alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(title = "Conditional Density Plot of O-ring Failures", x = "Temperature", fill = "O-ring Failure")
ggsave(filename, device = "png")
Note: Didn't use cdplot()

Query: You have the following data for NASA space shuttle o-ring failures where 1 means 'no' and 2 means 'yes': fail <- c(2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1) temperature <- c(53, 57, 58, 63, 66, 67, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70, 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81) Plot a red line showing cumulative conditional density of o-ring failures given temperature. Overlay points for failure/no failure observations plotted at probability = 1 or 0.
Ref_Code:
## NASA space shuttle o-ring failures
fail <- factor(c(2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1,
                 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1),
               levels = 1:2, labels = c("no", "yes"))
temperature <- c(53, 57, 58, 63, 66, 67, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70,
                 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81)

## scatter plot with conditional density
cdens <- cdplot(fail ~ temperature, plot = FALSE)
plot(I(as.numeric(fail) - 1) ~ jitter(temperature, factor = 2),
     xlab = "Temperature", ylab = "Conditional failure probability")
lines(53:81, 1 - cdens[[1]](53:81), col = 2)
Gen_Code:
# make_plot
png(filename)
fail <- c(2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1)
temperature <- c(53, 57, 58, 63, 66, 67, 67, 67, 68, 69, 70, 70, 70, 70, 72, 73, 75, 75, 76, 76, 78, 79, 81)
plot(temperature, fail - 1, type="n", xlab="Temperature", ylab="Probability of Failure", yaxt = 'n')
axis(2, at = 0:1, labels = c("No Failure", "Failure"))

# Plot observations
points(temperature, fail - 1, pch = 19)

# Fit logistic regression for cumulative probability
fit <- glm(fail - 1 ~ temperature, family = binomial(link = "logit"))

# Predict probabilities and plot
temp_seq <- seq(min(temperature), max(temperature), length.out = 100)
pred_probs <- predict(fit, newdata = data.frame(temperature = temp_seq), type = "response")
lines(temp_seq, pred_probs, col = "red")
dev.off()
Note: Didn't use cdplot()

Query: A Topographic Map of Maunga Whau (single color)
Ref_Code:
rx <- range(x <- 10*1:nrow(volcano))
ry <- range(y <- 10*1:ncol(volcano))
ry <- ry + c(-1, 1) * (diff(rx) - diff(ry))/2
tcol <- terrain.colors(12)
par(pty = "s", bg = "lightcyan")
plot(x = 0, y = 0, type = "n", xlim = rx, ylim = ry, xlab = "", ylab = "")
u <- par("usr")
rect(u[1], u[3], u[2], u[4], col = tcol[8], border = "red")
contour(x, y, volcano, col = tcol[2], lty = "solid", add = TRUE,
        vfont = c("sans serif", "plain"))
title("A Topographic Map of Maunga Whau", font = 4)
abline(h = 200*0:4, v = 200*0:4, col = "lightgray", lty = 2, lwd = 0.1)
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# make_plot
png(filename)
image(volcano, col = terrain.colors(1), axes = FALSE)
contour(volcano, add = TRUE)
axis(1, at = seq(0, ncol(volcano), length.out = 5), labels = round(seq(0, ncol(volcano), length.out = 5)))
axis(2, at = seq(0, nrow(volcano), length.out = 5), labels = round(seq(0, nrow(volcano), length.out = 5)))
box()
dev.off()

Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# help_topic
# 'topic': 'VADeaths'

# make_plot
png(filename)
dotchart(VADeaths, groups = rownames(VADeaths), xlim = c(0, 100), main = "Virginia Deaths by Age Group", xlab = "Death Rate (%)")
dev.off()

# make_plot
png(filename)
# Convert death rates to percentage of total for each age group
VADeaths_percent <- prop.table(VADeaths, 1) * 100
# Create a dotchart with age as first group
dotchart(VADeaths_percent, groups = rownames(VADeaths), xlim = c(0, 100), main = "Virginia Deaths by Age Group", xlab = "Death Rate (%)")
dev.off()

# make_plot
png(filename)
# Flatten the VADeaths matrix for plotting
drates <- as.vector(t(VADeaths))
# Set age groups as labels
groups <- rep(rownames(VADeaths), each = ncol(VADeaths))
# Plot dotchart
spot <- dotchart(drates, labels = groups, xlim = c(0, 100), main = "Virginia Deaths by Age Group", xlab = "Death Rate (%)")
# Add groupings on y-axis
axis(2, at = unique(spot$y), labels = rep(colnames(VADeaths), times = nrow(VADeaths)), las = 2)
dev.off()

# make_plot
png(filename)
# Flatten the VADeaths matrix for plotting
flattened_values <- as.vector(t(VADeaths))
# Define age groups as labels
age_groups <- rep(rownames(VADeaths), each = ncol(VADeaths))
# Plot dotchart
spot <- dotchart(flattened_values, labels = age_groups, xlim = c(0, 100), main = "Virginia Deaths by Age Group", xlab = "Death Rate (%)")
# Add grouping labels on y-axis based on population groups
axis(2, at = seq_along(flattened_values), labels = rep(colnames(VADeaths), times = nrow(VADeaths)), las = 2)
dev.off()

filled.contour(x, y, volcano,
    color.palette = function(n) hcl.colors(n, "terrain"),
    plot.title = title(main = "The Topography of Maunga Whau",
    xlab = "Meters North", ylab = "Meters West"),
    plot.axes = { axis(1, seq(100, 800, by = 100))
                  axis(2, seq(100, 600, by = 100)) },
    key.title = title(main = "Height
(meters)"),
    key.axes = axis(4, seq(90, 190, by = 10)))  # maybe also asp = 1
mtext(paste("filled.contour(.) from", R.version.string),
      side = 1, line = 4, adj = 1, cex = .66)
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# help_topic
# 'topic': 'filled.contour'

# make_plot
png(filename)
filled.contour(volcano, 
               color.palette = function(n) hcl.colors(n, "terrain"),
               plot.title = title(main = "The Topography of Maunga Whau",
               xlab = "Meters North", ylab = "Meters West"),
               plot.axes = { axis(1, seq(100, 800, by = 100))
                             axis(2, seq(100, 600, by = 100)) },
               key.title = title(main = "Height
(meters)"),
               key.axes = axis(4, seq(90, 190, by = 10)))
dev.off()

Query: volcano data: Use image() to plot topography of Maunga Whau Volcano with terrain colors, overlay brown contour lines
Ref_Code:
x <- 10*(1:nrow(volcano))
y <- 10*(1:ncol(volcano))
image(x, y, volcano, col = hcl.colors(100, "terrain"), axes = FALSE)
contour(x, y, volcano, levels = seq(90, 200, by = 5),
        add = TRUE, col = "brown")
axis(1, at = seq(100, 800, by = 100))
axis(2, at = seq(100, 600, by = 100))
box()
title(main = "Maunga Whau Volcano", font.main = 4)
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# help_topic
# 'topic': 'volcano'

# make_plot
png(filename)
image(volcano, col = terrain.colors(100), asp = 1)
contour(volcano, add = TRUE, col = 'brown')
dev.off()

Query: iris data: Plot width vs length with symbols: s/v for Setosa/Versicolor, red/blue for petals/sepals, lowercase/uppercase for petals/sepals.
Ref_Code:
table(iris$Species) # is data.frame with 'Species' factor
iS <- iris$Species == "setosa"
iV <- iris$Species == "versicolor"
op <- par(bg = "bisque")
matplot(c(1, 8), c(0, 4.5), type =  "n", xlab = "Length", ylab = "Width",
        main = "Petal and Sepal Dimensions in Iris Blossoms")
matpoints(iris[iS,c(1,3)], iris[iS,c(2,4)], pch = "sS", col = c(2,4))
matpoints(iris[iV,c(1,3)], iris[iV,c(2,4)], pch = "vV", col = c(2,4))
legend(1, 4, c("    Setosa Petals", "    Setosa Sepals",
               "Versicolor Petals", "Versicolor Sepals"),
       pch = "sSvV", col = rep(c(2,4), 2))
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# make_plot
png(filename)
data(iris)
par(mfrow=c(1, 2))
plot(iris$Sepal.Length, iris$Sepal.Width, col=ifelse(iris$Species=='setosa', 'red', 'blue'), pch=ifelse(iris$Species=='setosa', 's', 'v'), xlab='Sepal Length', ylab='Sepal Width', main='Sepals: Length vs Width')
plot(iris$Petal.Length, iris$Petal.Width, col=ifelse(iris$Species=='setosa', 'red', 'blue'), pch=ifelse(iris$Species=='setosa', 'S', 'V'), xlab='Petal Length', ylab='Petal Width', main='Petals: Length vs Width')
dev.off()
Note: Should use one panel; Incorrect color assignment

ry <- range(y <- -loc[,2])

abline(h = pretty(rx, 10), v = pretty(ry, 10), col = "lightgray")
text(x, y, labels(eurodist), cex = 0.8)

Query: Use mean radius and mean perimeter from data. Calculate perimeter from 2*pi*mean radius, then calculate delta perimeter (calculated perimeter - mean perimeter). Plot delta perimeter (y) vs mean radius (x). Use symbols for diagnosis: solid red squares for M (malignant) and open black circles for B (benign). Apply 50% transparency to red and black colors.
Ref_Code:
df <- read.csv("data/breast-cancer.csv")
pch <- ifelse(df$diagnosis == "M", 15, 1)
col_B <- adjustcolor(1, alpha.f = 0.5)
col_M <- adjustcolor(2, alpha.f = 0.5)
col <- ifelse(df$diagnosis == "M", col_M, col_B)
p_calc <- df$radius_mean * 2 * pi
delta_p <- df$perimeter_mean - p_calc
plot(df$radius_mean, delta_p, pch = pch, col = col)
Gen_Code:
# help_package
# 'package': 'datasets'

# help_topic
# 'topic': 'pi'

# run_visible
# Load the data from the uploaded CSV file
df <- read.csv('/tmp/uploads/breast-cancer.csv')

data_summary(df)

# make_plot
png(filename)
# Calculate perimeter and delta perimeter
df$calculated_perimeter <- 2 * pi * df$radius_mean
df$delta_perimeter <- df$calculated_perimeter - df$perimeter_mean

# Define color and symbols for diagnosis
df$color <- ifelse(df$diagnosis == "M", rgb(1, 0, 0, 0.5), rgb(0, 0, 0, 0.5))
df$symbol <- ifelse(df$diagnosis == "M", 15, 1) # Solid squares for M (15), open circles for B (1)

# Plot
plot(df$radius_mean, df$delta_perimeter, col=df$color, bg=df$color, pch=df$symbol,
     xlab="Mean Radius", ylab="Delta Perimeter",
     main="Delta Perimeter vs Mean Radius")
dev.off()

Query: Generate three metrics for radius: 1. mean radius, 2. radius calculated from mean perimeter, 3. radius calculated from mean area (calculations using basic geometry formulas). Make a long data frame with diagnosis, metric (mean, perimeter, area), and radius values. Use factor interaction (?boxplot) to show radius grouped by diagnosis and metric.
Ref_Code:
df <- read.csv("data/breast-cancer.csv")
radius_peri <- df$perimeter_mean / 2 / pi
radius_area <- sqrt(df$area_mean / pi)
wide_df <- data.frame(diagnosis = df$diagnosis, radius_mean = df$radius_mean, radius_peri, radius_area)
long_df <- reshape(wide_df, direction = "long", varying = colnames(wide_df)[2:4], sep = "_", timevar = "metric")
boxplot(radius ~ metric:diagnosis, data = long_df)
Gen_Tool: help_topic, run_visible, run_visible, run_visible, run_visible, run_visible, make_plot
Gen_Code:
# help_topic
# 'topic': 'boxplot'

# run_visible
df <- read.csv("/tmp/uploads/breast-cancer.csv")
library(dplyr)
# Calculate the metrics
metrics <- df %>%
  summarise(mean_radius = mean(radius_mean, na.rm = TRUE),
            radius_perimeter = mean(perimeter_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / (2 * pi),
            radius_area = sqrt(mean(area_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / pi))
# Create a long dataframe with diagnosis, metric and radius
long_df <- df %>%
  select(diagnosis) %>%
  mutate(mean_radius = mean(radius_mean, na.rm = TRUE),
         radius_perimeter = mean(perimeter_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / (2 * pi),
         radius_area = sqrt(mean(area_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / pi)) %>%
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = starts_with("radius"),
                      names_to = "metric",
                      values_to = "radius") %>%
  mutate(metric = recode(metric,
                         "mean_radius" = "mean",
                         "radius_perimeter" = "perimeter",
                         "radius_area" = "area"))
data_summary(long_df)

# run_visible
colnames(df)

# run_visible
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
# Calculate the metrics
metrics <- df %>%
  summarise(mean_radius = mean(radius_mean, na.rm = TRUE),
            radius_perimeter = mean(perimeter_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / (2 * pi),
            radius_area = sqrt(mean(area_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / pi))
# Create a long dataframe with diagnosis, metric and radius
long_df <- df %>%
  select(diagnosis) %>%
  mutate(mean_radius = mean(radius_mean, na.rm = TRUE),
         radius_perimeter = mean(perimeter_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / (2 * pi),
         radius_area = sqrt(mean(area_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / pi)) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = starts_with("radius"),
                      names_to = "metric",
                      values_to = "radius") %>%

                         "mean_radius" = "mean",
                         "radius_perimeter" = "perimeter",
                         "radius_area" = "area"))

# run_visible
head(df)

# run_visible
# Load the necessary libraries
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)

# Calculate the metrics
metrics <- df %>%
  summarise(mean_radius = mean(radius_mean, na.rm = TRUE),
            radius_perimeter = mean(perimeter_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / (2 * pi),
            radius_area = sqrt(mean(area_mean, na.rm = TRUE) / pi))

# Create a long dataframe with diagnosis, metric and radius
long_df <- df %>%
  select(diagnosis, radius_mean, perimeter_mean, area_mean) %>%
  mutate(
    mean_radius = metrics$mean_radius,
    radius_perimeter = metrics$radius_perimeter,
    radius_area = metrics$radius_area
  ) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(mean_radius, radius_perimeter, radius_area),
                      names_to = "metric",
                      values_to = "radius") %>%
  mutate(metric = recode(metric,
                         "mean_radius" = "mean",
                         "radius_perimeter" = "perimeter",
                         "radius_area" = "area"))

data_summary(long_df)

# make_plot
png(filename)
# Create boxplot with interaction of factors
boxplot(radius ~ diagnosis:metric, data = long_df,
        main = "Boxplot of Radius by Diagnosis and Metric",
        xlab = "Diagnosis : Metric",
        ylab = "Radius",
        col = c("lightblue", "lightgreen", "lightpink"))
dev.off()
